item.title: Ask HN: Who is hiring? (December 2012)
item.text:
Please lead with the location of the position and include the keywords INTERN, REMOTE, or H1B if the corresponding sort of candidate is welcome. Feel free to post any job that may interest HN readers from executive assistant to machine learning expert to CTO.

Also see:

"Ask HN: Freelancer? Seeking freelancer?" http://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=4857717

"Ask HN: Who is meeting up?" http://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=4857727

item.text: Please see this month's canonical post @ http://news.ycombinator.org/item?id=3300290

item.title: Ask HN: Should we agree to submit all Who is Hiring? posts via this account?
item.text:
I will use this account to submit

  Who is Hiring (Month YYYY)?
  Who is Hiring Remote Workers (Month YYYY)?
  Who is Hiring Interns (Month YYYY)?
posts on the 1st of each month at the start of the business day in the United States.

This could put an end to our peers competing to put forward Who Is Hiring threads by submitting them increasingly prematurely.

Please see the "Who is hiring?" post from the usual account "whoishiring" at http://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=4857714

Also see:

"Ask HN: Freelancer? Seeking freelancer?" http://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=4857717

"Ask HN: Who is meeting up?" http://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=4857727
